Command line invocation of wrapper.exe terminates with the following error:

jvm 1    |  INFO | Database ..\..\data\kahadb\lock is locked... waiting 10 secon
ds for the database to be unlocked. Reason: java.io.FileNotFoundException: ..\..
\data\kahadb\lock (Access is denied)
fields.summary: Java Wrapper Service does not Start on Windows 7 Enterprise SP1
fields.environment:
Windows 7 Enterprise SP1, Java 1.6.x, Administrative Access enabled on wrapper.exe
Binary Path:  "C:\activemq" linked (junction) to C:\Program Files (x86)\Apache Software Foundation\apache-activemq-5.5.1

comments.body:
I beleive when you run as a Service from an admin account you need to ensure that the temp dir is created, C:\Windows\System32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Local\Temp

See: AMQ-2946
Configuration issue.  When running as a service the user needs to ensure that the temp dir exists or set an env var pointing to where the temp dir is they want to use.
